content: skinny scarf necklace by on needles and hooks july 2020 © on needlesandhooks 1 skinny scarf necklace do you ever have a little bit of fingering yarn left over after a project this is just the project to use it up it is a long skinny scarf with a tapered end i have made it with detachable beaded fringe or a tassel on the ends you will be able to change the fringe each season or even use a clip on charm to change the look every time you wear it make a few to layer in different colors materials hook size g/4 25mm 1 ball knit picks chroma fingering wt yarn 70% wool 30% nylon 396 yds/ 100gms project uses 25-30 gm of yarn any fingering weight yarn should work beads if you are making the beaded fringe i used 1 focal bead 16 smaller beads three 7mm seed beads for the ends 1 clasp hook for each 1 gauge gauge is not critical for this pattern measurements 62 inches long with 5 inch tassel and 1 5 inch beaded fringe plain scarf is 55 5 inches long and 2 inches wide pattern notes the rings at ends of the scarf create a space to attach tassels beaded fringe or a charm special stitches v_stitch double_crochet ch2 double_crochet in same st or space © on needlesandhooks 2
